Lack of experience: The owner of the new business may not have prior experience in running a business, which can make it difficult to navigate the challenges that come with starting a new venture.
Competition: There may be existing businesses in the same industry that can make it difficult for the new business to gain a foothold in the market.
Legal and regulatory compliance: The new business must comply with various laws and regulations, which can be time-consuming and costly.
Marketing and branding: The new business needs to establish a strong brand and marketing strategy to attract customers and stand out from competitors.
Hiring and retaining employees: Finding and retaining qualified employees can be challenging, especially in a new business that may not have a reputation or established culture.
